Environmental Education and Public Awareness  
 
1Author    
Banti Dutta  
 
 ARTICLE INFO    ABSTRACT  
Environmental sensitivity in our country can only grow through a 
major public awareness campaign. The tremendous signification 
of the message of environmental education for the survival of 
man has made the relatively new academic discipline to attract 
great attention. Lack of adequate environmental knowledge is an obstacle in achieving a 
sustainable future for humankind at both global and local levels. Environmental awareness 
programme can help reduce the impacts of human activities on the environment. 
Environmental education has an effective role in creating healthy awareness and preparing 
suitable environment for the development and maintenance of human minds. It includes both 
formal and informal education and training that increase human capacity and capa bility to 
participate in environmental management and in solving environmental crisis and challenges. 
This could be achieved by increasing awareness and effectively changing the individual outlook 
on the environment. Educating adult, community, traditional  and religious leaders on the 
importance of environmental health and on the well use of the natural environment is also very 
critical to sustainable development. This paper is an attempt to review the meaning of 
environmental education, its aims and object ives, and ways of promoting environmental 
awareness in the society. It also considered how environmental education can be implemented 
in many contexts. The paper concluded with recommendations of ways of sensitizing the public 
on the need to be environment al conscious.  
 
Keywords:   
Education, Environment, Awareness  
                                                      
1 Corresponding Author : Assistant Professor, Department of Education, Laluk College, Assam

INTRODUCTIO N 
 
Environment is a physical, chemical and biological setting in which people live. It is a 
sum total of water, air, and land, interrelationship among themselves and also with 
human beings, other living organism and property. The most terrible problem in the 
21st century is rapid degradation of environmental quality. The rapid growt h of 
population creates situations like more people need more food, more energy, and 
more things of daily use. So we use more water resources, fertilizers, pesticide etc . for 
more production and it turns it increase the level of pollution of air, water and  soil 
which creates the ecological imbalanced in the ecosystem. Lack of environmental 
awareness in the preservation and conservation of environment effectively made the 
situation more critical. All these are responsible for rapid degradation of environment al 
quality. If such situation would be continued in the near future, the whole human 
civilization will face very dangerous situation in various spheres. In this context, the only 
alternative is to create Environmental awareness among the masses in respect of 
protection and preservation of environment and also for the alleviation of 
environmental degeneration. Therefore, it is essential to provide environmental 
education to the public to raise awareness about environmental issues.  
 
Environmental Education  
 
Environmental Education (EE) is a learning process by which people develop awareness, 
concern knowledge of the environment and learn to use this understanding to 
preserve, conserve and utilize the environment in a sustainable manner for the benefit 
of prese nt and future generation. It focused on the protection and improvement of our 
total environment, developing and conserving those components traditionally 
recognized as natural resources like soil, water, air, forest etc, making the population 


Website: https://lgcollege.ac.in/  Page | 60                             KANCHIOLI                            ISSN :  2583 -0740 (online)  
                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
aware of prob lems, skilled and willing to participate in environmental management. 
Environmental Education helps to improve the “quality of the environment”. It is also 
improve the quality of life of man.  
 
Environmental Education is not a separate branch of science or subject but it has been 
formulated into a definite discipline with clearly defined content area and it should be 
carried out according to the principle of lifelong education. Environmental education 
includes both formal and informal education and training that increase human capacity 
and capability to participate in environmental awareness programmed. This could be 
achieved by increasing awareness and effectively changing the individual outlook on 
the environment.  
SCOPE OF THE STUDY  
This paper discusses the goal, objectives, importance of environmental education and 
includes a descriptive study on how environmental education can raise public 
awareness and how environmental awareness can contribute to a healthy environment 
has been taken.  
IMPORTANCE OF TH E STUDY  
This is worth mentioning that  Earth is the most precious gift of the universe. It is the 
sustenance of nature that is the key to the development of the future of mankind. It is 
the duty and responsibility to each one of us to protect nature. It is here that the 
understanding of the “E nvironment” comes in to the picture. The degradation of our 
environment is linked with the development process and the ignorance of people 
about retaining the ecological balance. Indeed, no citizen of the earth can afford to 
remain aloof from the issue rel ated to the environment. It is therefore essentially 
important that the study of the environment becomes an integral part of the education 
process. Because Environmental education increase the public awareness and 


Website: https://lgcollege.ac.in/  Page | 61                             KANCHIOLI                            ISSN :  2583 -0740 (online)  
                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
knowledge about environmental issues or pr oblems. It will help to keep our 
environment healthy and strong. And for that a thorough study or  research is much 
needed.  
OBJECTIVES OF THE ST UDY  
 
The primary goals of this study are to review the status of Environmental Education and 
to sensitize the public on the need to be conscious about their environment and to 
suggest ways by which the public could be educated about the environment. The main 
objectives are – 
1) Review briefly the goals of Environmental Education.  
2) Sensitize the public on the need to d evelop positive attitude towards a better 
interaction with the natural world.  
3) Suggest ways of educating the public on the need to be environmental 
conscious.  
METHODOLOGY  
The study is basically concerned with the Environmental education and Public 
awareness. The method used for study in descriptive in nature. Secondary data have 
been used for the purpose of the study which were collected from the published 
sources like b ooks, journals, magazines, news paper etc. whatever information is 
collected is simply arranged and described.

                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDU CATION  
Environmental education has to develop a sense of responsibility amongst the nature 
of the world to take collective actions towards the conservation and preservation of the 
natural world. It encourages the individuals to learn about nature and develop skills to 
protect it. The main goal is to develop concern and awareness among world 
population about the total environment and its associated problems.  
 
The main aims and object ives of environmental educations are - 
1) To improve the quality of environment.  
2) To create awareness among the people on environmental problems and 
conservations.  
3) To create an atmosphere so that people participate in decision making and 
develop the capabiliti es to evaluate the developmental programme.  
4) To develop the attitude to take steps for environmental protection. There should 
be a sense of responsibility among the population to protect the environment.  
ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCAT ION AND ITS NEED  
Environmental education is a process of educating the people about the natural 
environment and its problems; way of understanding environment. It is concerned with 
the dynamic relationship between man and nature. Environmental Education is nothing 
but teac hing a person how to interact fully with surrounding world so that to improve 
his own inner world, to understand and appreciate the inter -relationship between man 
and his biophysical surrounding. It is a life -long forwarded looking education and it 
means t he generation of widespread awareness of environmental problem. Life on 
Earth depends upon the availability of land, water, air, energy, minerals, climate, flora 
and fauna. We with the help of our own efforts and technology transform these 
resources in to goods and services to raise the students of living. The word 
environment includes all parts of nature require for health and happiness of man. The 
very existence of life on Earth depends on nature. Hence, it is the urgent need to the 
hour to take measures for the protection of environment, since the problems of 


Website: https://lgcollege.ac.in/  Page | 63                             KANCHIOLI                            ISSN :  2583 -0740 (online)  
                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
environmental pollution and ecological degradation is threatening the survival of 
mankind. Protection of environment is a fundamental duty of every Indian. Awareness, 
knowledge and understanding abou t environmental problems and its protection is very 
much relevant, indispensable and of great significance for each and every citizens in 
present society. Due to tackle the problem of environmental hazards effectively, the 
Government of India has passed se veral Acts for the protection of environment. The 
most important ones are – 
 Wild life protection Acts, 1972 -1986.  
 Water (prevention and control of pollution)Acts, 1974.  
 Water pollution less Act, 1980.  
 Forest (conservation) Act, 1980  
 Air (prevention and control of pollution) Act, 1981  
 The Environment (protection) Act, 1986.  
 Biological Diversity Act, 2002  
In spite of all these efforts of the Government of India to take measure for protecting 
and improving the quality of the environment and preventing and c ontrolling. Actually, 
no summit, no government effort, no organizatio n can success in reducing Green house 
effect, in protecting biological diversity, in reducing ozone layer depletion and so on 
until people sensitize it personally. Environmental protection  is the prime need of our 
times. In this context, Environmental awareness movement is very essential. But lack of 
sufficient knowledge about the fundamentals to control various kinds of pollution has 
become a very serious problem. Hence it is in the time t o march forward in spreading 
Environmental Education amongst all the section of the people.  
IMPORTANCE OF PUBLIC  AWARENESS ABOUT ENVI RONMENTAL PROTECTION  
Public awareness and knowledge of environmental protection are crucial to avoid 
environmental pollutions. If we have to improve the environment, public awareness is 


Website: https://lgcollege.ac.in/  Page | 64                             KANCHIOLI                            ISSN :  2583 -0740 (online)  
                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
the primary requirement. Human activities are causing many kinds of environmental 
pollution s for which public awareness is necessary. Everyone needs to make aware and 
motivate each and every individual for environmental consciousness. There must be 
planning about the effects and control measures of environmental pollution. 
Government should init iate and help by awareness campaigns to save environment. 
There are a number of ways in which we can spread awareness and educate the public 
how to protect the environment.  
 Running awareness campaigns  
 Providin g environmental education in  school level.  
 Regulating environmental legal rights and responsibilities  
 Spreading awareness via (through) the media  
 Encouraging public participation  
Today, these initiatives are being undertaken by the government, the media, as well as 
by schools at a considerable leve l. This is particularly important because as citizens, 
most of the environmental issues arise out of our way of living. Population explosion, 
industrialization and urbanization are some of the primary reasons for environmental 
degradation. Awareness in all  sections of the society can be spread through various 
general public awareness programmes. Only with collective thinking we will be able to 
restore balance in our environment.  
The government plays an important role in creating public awareness. The 
„Envir onmental Education, Awareness and Training‟ programme of the Government of 
India aims at developing public knowledge and skills to protect the environment. As 
part of the programme, during the year 2007 -2008, 83372 eco -clubs were created in 
India. Between 2007 and 2008, 9938 associations were included in the awareness 
programme and financial assistance was provided. National TV and radio were used as 
a means of spreading awareness.

                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
RECOMMENDATIONS  
1. Government should organize Environmental Education campaign programmes 
for children, youth, men and women. The state government should establish 
appropriate funding mechanisms for raising public awareness of environmental 
education.  
2. Government officials ca n make significant contributions to improve public 
awareness of environmental education.  
3. NGOs (at national and community levels) should initiate and help by awareness 
campaigns to save environment.  
4. Ban the littering of polythene cannot be successful until the public understands 
the environmental implications of the same.  
5. Proper methods of disposal and its treatment should be applied otherwise they 
can be the causes of chronic diseases.  
By exercising following actions, humans can protect global environment for sustainable 
development: these are - 
i. Preserve forest cover: Humans should minimize cutting of trees and using timber for 
aesthetic pleasure such as decoration of drawing rooms.  
ii. Preserve natural resources: Human should not extract unnecessarily a nd exhaustively 
the natural resources such as mineral resources, water resources, etc.  
iii. Conserve energy: Human should not harness too much energy from burning of 
fossil fuels.  
iv. Practice green technology: Everyone from a farmer in the village to a po licy planner 
in the government should use green technology that incorporates: treatment of air 
emissions, treatment of waste waters, waste reduction, waste or emission management, 
use of non -conventional, renewable energy resources like solar energy on pri ority, etc.  


Website: https://lgcollege.ac.in/  Page | 66                             KANCHIOLI                            ISSN :  2583 -0740 (online)  
                  ( Journal of Humanities and Social Sciences )  
                                                     Volume - III, Issue – 1, JUNE -2023 
  
CONCLUSION  
There is an urgent need to safeguard our environment to save the future generation. 
Environmental awareness is the suitable tool for conservation of our natural resources 
and their valuable components. Environmentally illiterate individuals cannot successf ully 
solve complex problems. It requires understanding the immediate and real needs of a 
country like ours by initiating a local process through Environmental Education 
programme. Environmental training programme can also promote better health and 
hygienic  conditions. The awareness programmes would empower the people to take 
up appropriate steps to preserve and protect our environment. Environmental 
education and environmental awareness programme are to be conducted from 
primary to university level of educa tion are the better channels to which information 
can be disseminated to the grassroots level and these programmes would enable the 
masses to protect the environment which is very urgent for us to survive on Earth.  
 
REFERENCES  
1. Bhaskar, A, Yerroju (2011).  Education and Society. Disc overy  Publishing house, New 
Delhi.  
2. Ahluwalia, S.P. and Bais,  H.S. (1992) . Environmental education.  Ashish publishing house,  
New Delhi.  
3. Buragohain, P.P et al. (2017). Paribesh Adhyayan , Banalata, Dibrugarh.  
4. Nath, Bhaskar (2009). Environ mental education and Awareness. Vol.1. Encyclopedi a of 
Life Support System.  
5. Goswami, M. (2016). Enviro nmental education and Awareness.
